author: The Editorial Board
title: A Welcome China Trade Truce
text:
The U.S. and China struck a truce on trade over the weekend, and on Monday the financial markets signaled their approval with a rally in equities. That should be a message to President Trump that his negotiators are on the right track in trying to open China’s market, instead of closing America’s.
The biggest relief is that “both parties have agreed to suspend the tariffs” each had previously threatened, as Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Monday. That takes off the table U.S. levies on $150 billion of Chinese goods...
